name: TheAtlantic
text: What did we lose when the White House mandated hospitals stop sending data to the CDC? @AlexisMadrigal explains: https://t.co/jCcbTv4JFB

name: TheAtlantic
text: "These dismal times, as the virus rages and historic protests continue in the wake of George Floyd’s slaying, can be the springboard for a Third Reconstruction," @wuc3 writes: https://t.co/2MnukW2gTM

name: TheAtlantic
text:
A South Korean study has found that older children can spread the coronavirus just as much as adults.

Earlier this month, @SarahCohodes argued that schools must prioritize reopening for younger children. https://t.co/3UxvvZnqn7

name: TheAtlantic
text: “The unmitigated injury of slavery and racism did not end with abolition or the civil-rights era; instead, like interest on debt, its impact has compounded," @wuc3 writes. "Continued inaction...will make racial justice ever more difficult to achieve."https://t.co/FpYoGim4uo

name: TheAtlantic
text: Just in: The man suspected of shooting Judge Esther Salas’s husband and son in their New Jersey home had published 10,000 pages of racism, misogyny, and support for President Trump online. He also attacked Salas by name, @jbenton reports: https://t.co/EEklY1MxF2

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: There's way more detail in the documents @jbenton uncovered compared with what's already been reported. This story just went live, and it's disturbing:  https://t.co/4GmecsJHDr

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: Italy rallied after being hit hard by the pandemic. But it is not out of the woods. The coronavirus exposed the West's weakest link, @RachelDonadio writes: https://t.co/Bo0ZGJTKOT

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: President Trump is cobbling together something the U.S. has never had before—a national police force, used to quell protests. https://t.co/2zqO7cAjSe

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @beccarosen: .@jbenton read through the online writings of Roy Den Hollander, the suspected shooter of the NJ judge's family. “The Feminists should be careful…," Den Hollander wrote. "There are 300 million firearms in this country, and most of them are owned by guys.” https://t.co/IEj13ZMKpb

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Tulane and other campuses are slated to reopen for in-person instruction in the fall. Students will get infected, and universities will rebuke them for it; campuses will close, and students will be blamed for it."
https://t.co/8UteGhr51I

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The past decade has witnessed a dangerous trend: a Supreme Court that expresses deep suspicion of Congress’s competence and motives," Jonathan S. Gould and Olatunde C. A. Johnson write: https://t.co/VkfbeMzcI6

name: TheAtlantic
text: Italy rallied after being hit hard by the pandemic. But it is not out of the woods. The coronavirus exposed the West's weakest link, @RachelDonadio writes: https://t.co/3kmAFIb23m

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @DKThomp: In 1995, the NRA fundraised by condemning Clinton's “jackbooted thugs" that would "harass, intimidate, even murder law-abiding citizens."

On Thursday, the NRA endorsed Trump, as his armored officers harassed and detained peaceful protesters in Portland.

https://t.co/yjpwzynHxt https://t.co/Dcay8sd1pt

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @GrahamDavidA: 25 years ago, the NRA warned of "jackbooted thugs" from the federal government taking away citizens' rights.

Last week they appeared, in Portland, at Donald Trump's command—just as the NRA endorsed Trump for reelection: https://t.co/KCGOk5SS8U

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @LaurieAbraham2: The events chronicled here have to be read to believed. And the video is as powerful and haunting as the storytelling. Major props to The Marshall Project's Eli Hager for this powerful story about restorative justice. https://t.co/7LrN6K6aUa
